metadata.name: Cat Sudoers
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of a cat /etc/sudoers to list all users that have sudo rights

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/cat')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('grep')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/head')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/tail')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/more'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /etc/sudoers')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of a cat /etc/sudoers to list all users that have sudo rights

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities Reference: https://github.com/sleventyeleven/linuxprivchecker/
